page.title: 06Schooling:Chinnor etc
page.content: Chinnor has two Primary schools but no Secondary school. St Andrews C.E.School is the direct descendant of Chinnor C.E. School which had premises on the corner of Station Road until the population influx made this inadequate. New buildings were erected further along Station Road. By 1973, this school had over 800 pupils, using the old buildings as well as the new. During 1974, a new school was erected in Mill Lane, near the large newly-built housing estate. This school opened its doors under the name of Mill Lane School in September 1974 with an initial roll of approximately 480 children. At 11 years, children go on to either Icknield, Watlington, or Lord Williams's at Thame. Free transport is provided to both.
